cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language facilitates the establishment of rapport between people.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Directionality: from one person toward others

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is used to build interpersonal connections.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject contributes causally to the development or strengthening of the object (e.g., a social or interpersonal state).
args.justification: Both relations describe body language as helping to build or establish a positive interpersonal state (rapport, connections). The same causal-facilitative predicate applies, so they should share a single canonical predicate 'facilitates'.

These relations express that a communicative behavior (body language) facilitates the formation or strengthening of interpersonal connections or rapport. Grouping them under an interpersonal connection facilitation class captures that shared semantics.
In both cases, body language is described as causally contributing to the establishment of rapport or connections (a facilitating cause). This fits the broad causal/enablement dimension.
